definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Senderos played in most of the build-up matches.
sentences.chinese: 他倆在熱身賽中的表現如何？

sentences.english: "The pre-season was good, " declared the young Italian international to sportmediaset. it.
sentences.chinese: “我們的熱身賽表現很好”年輕的意大利國腳說到。

sentences.english: Playing in the pre-season games is in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 踢季前熱身賽在我想法之內。

sentences.english: Mon June 6th A pre-season friendly at Benfica is confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 月6日星期一做客本菲卡的賽季前熱身賽敲定。

sentences.english: We definitely don't want to lose any pre-season games.
sentences.chinese: 我們絕對不想失去任何季前熱身賽。

sentences.english: Before the beginning of the World Cup, we will attend two warm-up competitions.
sentences.chinese: 在世界盃開賽之前，我們還要進行兩場熱身賽。

sentences.english: But I will try to compete in some warm-ups before the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 但是我將在奧運會之前，在熱身賽中試着比賽。

definition: St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
Rostov-on-Don, Russian river port and regional capital close to Sea of Azov (north of the Black Sea)
